business.headline: Sensex closes 605 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; NTPC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 604.72 points to close at 83,576.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 193.55 points to end at 25,683.30.

Is sector rotation the real driver of returns in Indian equity markets?Sector rotation in its simplest form is the reaction of the market to shifts in the economic environment. The various sectors are enjoyed at various stages of the cycle.

Sensex falls over 600 points: What's behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street?Around 12:46 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 634.91 points to 83,546.05, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 188.80 points to 25,688.05. Most of the broader market indices also tumbled, reflecting the volatility on Dalal Street.

Mutual fund inflows cool off in December, down 6% to Rs 28,054 croreData released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India, or AMFI, showed that inflows into equity mutual funds fell 6% in December to Rs 28,054 crore.

BHEL share price jumps over 4%. Why is the stock rising today?BHEL shares were trading at Rs 282.40, up Rs 10.10 or 3.71% as of 10:10 AM. The stock had closed at Rs 272.30 in the last session. It opened higher at Rs 279.10 and moved up further during the day..

Sensex, Nifty trade setup: Will stock market fall again today?Both Sensex and Nifty have seen steady losses over the past four sessions. Nifty has fallen 1.7% during this period, while Sensex is down 1.8%.

India defends antitrust penalty law as Apple risks $38 billion fineThe company fears it could be fined up to $38 billion if the global turnover calculation is used, after a CCI investigation found it had abused its position on its app store. Apple denies the accusations.

Silver falls Rs 12,500, gold prices also easeInvestors remained cautious ahead of important global events, including expected US Supreme Court rulings on Trump-era tariffs and the release of US labour market data.

Who was Agnivesh Agarwal? Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal's son who dies at 49After completing his studies, Agnivesh went on to establish Fujeirah Gold, which earned a strong reputation in the metals business.

India considers easing curbs on Chinese firms in government contracts: ReportThe curbs have had a significant economic impact, effectively excluding Chinese firms from Indian government projects worth between nearly $700 billion and $750 billion.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: Sensex ends 780 points lower, Nifty falls below 26,000The Sensex closed 780 points lower, while the Nifty slipped under the psychologically important 26,000 level, reflecting growing investor caution amid mixed global cues and stock-specific pressure in frontline names. The fall was widespread, with most sectoral indices ending in negative territory.

entertainment.headline: Madras High Court flags 'dangerous trend' after Censor Board delays Jana Nayagan The Madras High Court cleared Jana Nayagan with a U/A 16+ certificate and reprimanded the CBFC for eleventh-hour objections that pushed the film's release. Starring Vijay, the film is now aiming for a Pongal 2026 release.

Emraan Hashmi on viral cameo in The Ba***ds of Bollywood: Nothing changed for me Emraan Hashmi says the viral response to his cameo in The Ba**ds of Bollywood has not changed anything for him, as he prefers to stay detached from success and online hype.

Cricket meets anime as Crunchyroll names Shubman Gill its India ambassador Crunchyroll has announced a collaboration with Indian cricketer Shubman Gill, aiming to strengthen anime's presence in India, particularly among younger viewers.

O Romeo: Shahid Kapoor's blood-soaked, tattooed look stuns in first poster Shahid Kapoor adopts a groundbreaking look for Vishal Bhardwaj's upcoming film O Romeo. Releasing February 13, 2026, this marks the duo's fourth collaboration.

Varun Dhawan reacts to trolling over Border 2 song Ghar Kab Jaoge Varun Dhawan addressed social media criticism about his role in the song Ghar Kab Aaoge from Border 2, responding with light-hearted remarks while preparing for the film's release.

Tu Ya Main teaser: Adarsh Gourav, Shanaya Kapoor and crocodile promise a thriller The first teaser for the upcoming film, Tu Yaa Main, starring Shanaya Kapoor and Adarsh Gourav, directed by Bejoy Nambiar, offers a glimpse into a suspenseful story about two content creators whose collaboration turns into a dangerous fight for survival. The film is set to reach cinemas on February 13, 2026.

Shriya Pilgaonkar on Haiwaan, her theatrical return: Want to make fearless choices After making her mark on OTT, Shriya Pilgaonkar is set to return to the big screen in 2026 with Haiwaan, her first theatrical release in five years.

Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain takes its comedy to cinemas. release date out 'Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain – Fun On The Run' is set to release in theatres on February 6. The film will mark the return of the popular actors, including Shubhangi Atre, Aasif Sheikh, Rohitashv Gour, and Vidisha Srivastava in key roles.

Angry fans storm Prabhas' The Raja Saab preview after delays hit Hyderabad Confusion over early screenings of The Raja Saab led to chaotic scenes at multiple Hyderabad cinemas, with fans forcefully entering venues and demanding updates after unexpected delays.

Haq vs Nikaah: Why 2025 film on triple talaq couldn't match 1982 hit's success Indian cinema has historically used storytelling to spotlight social issues, with classics like Nikaah successfully addressing triple talaq and women's rights. However, despite critical acclaim, the recent film Haq on the same subject failed to draw crowds to cinemas.

Britney Spears says she will never perform in the US again Britney Spears has stated she will not perform live in the United States again, citing sensitive reasons, but suggested the possibility of future performances in the United Kingdom and Australia alongside her son.

Maa Inti Bangaaram teaser trailer: Samantha plays housewife who is anything but that The teaser trailer for Maa Inti Bangaaram, starring Samantha Ruth Prabhu, was released on Friday. It offered a glimpse into a film that explores strength, vulnerability and family bonds.

Laalo - Krishna Sada Sahaayate review: A meditative, cinematic experienceRelease Date:Fri Jan 09, 2026 Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate review: It is a powerful Gujarati film that explores faith, belief and inner transformation through the journey of a troubled man. Meditative and grounded, it reflects on life, loss and the search for peace.

Zoya Akhtar shares old pic as Farah Khan-Farhan Akhtar celebrate birthdays together Zoya Akhtar shared a warm birthday wish for cousins Farah Khan and Farhan Akhtar, posting a nostalgic childhood photo and a sweet glimpse from their joint celebration.

Is Prabhas' The Raja Saab like Bhool Bhulaiyaa? Makers clarify the differences Prabhas' fantasy-horror comedy 'The Raja Saab' has opened in cinemas, with cast and crew clarifying that the film stands apart from Akshay Kumar's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' despite audience comparisons.

Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi gets U/A certificate, runtime revealed Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi has been granted a U/A certificate. The film, directed by Sudha Kongara, will hit theatres on January 10, 2026.

Kareena Kapoor reveals her trick to get Taimur and Jeh to pose Bollywood actor Kareena Kapoor recently amused fans by revealing her playful parenting tactics on social media, while also sharing a reflective note about overcoming the challenges of 2025.

Ishq Da Chehra: Diljit Dosanjh's song from Border 2 brings romance to the frontlines The latest track, Ishq Da Chehra, from the upcoming film Border 2, explores the deep personal connections of soldiers. Sung by Diljit Dosanjh, the song was composed by Sachet-Parampara.

Tanvi The Great completes 100 days, Anupam Kher calls it a film that wins hearts Anupam Kher celebrated 100 days of Tanvi The Great in theatres, calling the film a heartfelt journey that has quietly touched audiences.

general news.headline: Live: Mamata leads protest against I-PAC raids, ED seeks urgent court hearingED vs Mamata Banerjee Live Updates: Thousands of people joined West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee as she led a mega protest march over the ED's raids on the political consultancy firm I-PAC and the residence of its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata. Earlier today, eight Trinamool Congress MPs were detained and dragged by Delhi Police personnel for protesting outside Home Minister Amit Shah's office. There were dramatic scenes at the Calcutta High Court when the ED vs Trinamool Congress hearing got deferred to January 14 as the judge left the courtroom due to chaos caused by overcrowding. The ED has alleged "misconduct" by Banerjee during the raids, while the Trinamool Congress called the searches arbitrary and illegal. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Live: Focus on your country, Iran's Khamenei tells Trump, warns protestersAnti-Khamenei Protests live updates: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, on Friday said the Islamic Republic will not tolerate individuals acting as "mercenaries" for foreign powers, as unrest continues and tensions with Western countries remain high. Khamenei also took a swipe at former US President Donald Trump, telling him to focus on problems within his own country.

It's out there now. Trump taking it out on India as Modi didn't call, hurt his egoUS Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the whole trade deal was set up, but for it to reach its conclusion, PM Modi needed to call Trump. That eventually did not happen.

The ugly divorce battle of Zoho's Sridhar Vembu and a Rs 15,000 crore bondA US court has directed Zoho's Sridhar Vembu to post a $1.7 billion (Rs 15,278 crore) bond in the ongoing divorce case. It has brought into focus the high-stakes divorce battle between Vembu and his estranged wife, Pramila Srinivasan. Here is all about the case.

Why Trump's Greenland mineral dream is a miner's nightmareUS President Donald Trump's statements have sharpened attention on Greenland not only as a strategic military asset, but also as a potential treasure trove of minerals.

Bewafa teri dosti mein: Congress taunts PM after Trump aide's trade deal remarkPosting the clip on X, Congress leader Ramesh used a rhyming Hindi jibe to underline his criticism, suggesting a sharp contrast between past bonhomie and the current state of India–US engagement. The post appeared to question the government's handling of high-level diplomacy and its impact on stalled trade negotiations between the two countries.

High Court orders Vijay's Jana Nayagan's release, pulls up Censor Board chiefThe Madras High Court directed the CBFC to issue a U/A 16+ certificate to Vijay's Jana Nayagan, paving the way for its release after a censor delay that caused major losses to distributors.

The Leela, Udaipur fined Rs 10 lakh for privacy violation; guests were in bathroomA Chennai consumer court ordered The Leela Palace, Udaipur, to pay Rs 10 lakh compensation after holding the hotel guilty of privacy violation and service deficiency, following unlawful room entry by housekeeping staff.

Greenland vs America: The 1,000-year-old Viking story behind today's standoffAs the US renews interest in Greenland, Nordic countries are standing united. The standoff has revived memories of a forgotten chapter from history — when Viking settlers from Greenland reached North America centuries before Columbus, triggering violent clashes that ended in retreat and shaped Greenland's enduring strategic importance.

Cancelled 2nd wave of attacks: Trump says Venezuela freeing political prisonersDonald Trump said that Venezuela has begun releasing political prisoners and cooperating with the US on rebuilding its oil and gas sector, and hence, a second wave of attack on the country is not needed.

Mamata blocked ED raid, it was 3 officers vs dozens of cops: Sources on I-PAC raidWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee allegedly intervened during an Enforcement Directorate raid at Indian Political Action Committee premises, with sources claiming intimidation and pressure to alter records.

TCS halts appraisals of WFH employees after new 5-day office attendance mandateTCS has paused final anniversary appraisals for some employees who did not meet its strict five-day work-from-office requirement, linking attendance compliance directly to performance outcomes.

The Raja Saab review: Prabhas's horror comedy is devoid of charm, thrills and chillsRelease Date:Fri Jan 09, 2026The Raja Saab movie review: Director Maruthi's The Raja Saab, starring Prabhas, Sanjay Dutt and Nidhhi Agerwal, is a fantasy horror comedy that relies heavily on the lead actor. However, there's hardly anything that's redeemable in this soulless film.

Not Gaza, my life for Iran: Anti-Khamenei protesters target bullseyeThe slogan "Neither Gaza nor Lebanon, my life for Iran" rang out in Iran's Asgharabad, where protesters lit fires and chanted through the night as anti-Khamenei demonstrations entered their 13th day on Friday. The slogan is a rejection of the Khamenei regime's foreign policy priorities and proxy wars amid domestic distress.

'Sharma Ji Ka Beta' isn't choosing engineering anymore, data shows Gen Z is rewriting career rulesIndia's Gen Z is moving away from traditional engineering degrees towards skill-based and flexible careers. This shift challenges long-held parental expectations and may reshape India's education and job markets.

670-km motorcade amid storm: How US got Jaishankar to New York during shutdownA US government shutdown and snowstorm grounded flights, forcing US Diplomatic Security Service agents to move External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar by a 670 km armoured motorcade from the Canada border to New York.

We'll shoot first, talk later: Denmark warns US as Greenland dispute hots upThe 1952 Cold War-era rule, which was created when Nazi Germany attacked Denmark in April 1940 leading to a partial collapse of communications in the Scandinavian nation, has remained in place till date.

When BCCI's Jogu Da helped Bangladesh cricket pass crucial TestFormer BCCI president and then ICC chief Jagmohan Dalmiya played a decisive role in Bangladesh becoming the 10th nation to gain Test status through a unanimous vote in June 2000. India strongly backed Bangladesh's case, and that support proved crucial.

sports.headline: Manchester City sign Ghana forward Antoine Semenyo from AFC Bournemouth Manchester City have confirmed the signing of Antoine Semenyo from AFC Bournemouth for £65 million, a landmark deal that ranks among the most expensive transfers ever involving a Ghanaian player.

Virat Kohli should reverse Test retirement: T20 World Cup winner makes bold call T20 World Cup winner Robin Uthappa has urged star Indian batter Virat Kohli to reverse his Test retirement ahead of the upcoming three-match ODI series against New Zealand.

Kenya tennis admits wildcard blunder after player's embarrassing defeat goes viral A first-round match at the ITF W35 Nairobi tournament has prompted public scrutiny and an official response from Tennis Kenya over the awarding of a wildcard to Egyptian player Hajar Abdelkader. Hajar managed to win only three points and lost 0-6, 0-6 in her professional tennis debut.

WPL 2026: Meg Lanning vs Jemimah Rodrigues off-field banter steals the show UP Warriorz captain Meg Lanning shared playful off-field banter with her former teammate and Delhi Capitals skipper Jemimah Rodrigues during a pre-tournament show ahead of WPL 2026.

Arsenal's Martinelli 'deeply sorry' for pushing injured Bradley in Liverpool draw Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has apologised for his actions during the 0-0 Premier League draw against Liverpool after pushing injured defender Conor Bradley off the pitch.

Jay Shah has never held a bat, cricket ecosystem is hijacked: Ex BCB secretary Syed Ashraful Haque has criticised the politicisation of cricket administration in Asia amid rising tensions between BCB and BCCI over Mustafizur Rahman issue. The row threatens the T20 World Cup 2026 schedule, with Bangladesh seeking to shift matches outside India due to security concerns.

T20 World Cup row: Ex-captain cautions Bangladesh against bowing to public opinion Former captain Tamim Iqbal has warned against decisions driven by public sentiment as Bangladesh's participation in the T20 World Cup in India hangs in the balance. The Bangladesh Cricket Board has written to the International Cricket Council, urging it to move the team's matches out of India, citing security concerns.

New Year surprise? Virat Kohli shares training photos on Instagram after 2 years Virat Kohli ended a nearly three-year gap by sharing training photos on Instagram. The former India captain posted three images from a practice session with his teammates ahead of the ODI series opener against New Zealand in Vadodara on January 11.

The match was overshadowed by a heated sideline exchange between Vinícius Jr. and Atletico manager Diego Simeone on Thursday.

Rajinikanth punchline tattooed, New Zealand spinner Adithya Ashok ready to face India New Zealand leg spinner Adithya Ashok is set to play in the upcoming ODI series against India. Ashok, who has Tamil roots, trained at CSK academy in Chennai in 2025.

Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Australian Open singles, set to compete in doubles Nick Kyrgios has announced he will not compete in the singles draw at the Australian Open. He will instead focus on doubles as he recovers from injuries and prepares for future tournaments.

Did BCCI offer IPL return to Mustafizur Rahman? BCB president reacts to rumoursBCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul denies reports of any IPL return talks for Mustafizur Rahman with the BCCI. Bangladesh has also requested ICC to shift its T20 World Cup matches outside India over security concerns.

Watch: Rohit Sharma's priceless reaction after Jay Shah calls him India captainRohit Sharma was warmly called India captain by ICC chairman Jay Shah despite being replaced by Shubman Gill. Rohit led India to two ICC triumphs in 2024 and 2025 under his leadership.

Malaysia Open Live: PV Sindhu reaches semis after Yamaguchi retires with injuryMalaysia Open 2026 live score: PV Sindhu needed just 11 minutes on the court to win her quarterfinal match. She won the opening game 21-11 when her opponent, the third-seeded Akane Yamaguchi, retired with an injury.

WPL 2026: Champions Mumbai Indians meet revamped RCB in blockbuster startThe WPL 2026 season begins with a blockbuster as defending champions Mumbai Indians take on a revamped Royal Challengers Bengaluru side, setting the tone for a high-stakes campaign.

Tilak Varma issues injury update following surgery: On the road to recoveryIndia batter Tilak Varma has reassured the fans that he will be back on the field quickly after undergoing surgery earlier in the week. Tilak will head back to Hyderabad on Friday, January 9 and start his rehabilitation process.

Tata Steel Chess: Viswanathan Anand, Nihal Sarin share lead after six roundsViswanathan Anand and Nihal Sarin finished day two of the Tata Steel Chess India Rapid on top of the Open standings after six rounds, both accumulating 4.5 points. In the women's category, Kateryna Lagno maintained a clear lead with 4.5 points, while Indian participants faced mixed results across the leaderboard.

Vijay Hazare Trophy Roundup: Delhi, Punjab, Vidarbha and UP book quarterfinal spotsDelhi, Punjab, Vidarbha and Uttar Pradesh booked Vijay Hazare Trophy quarterfinal spots as big wins and late drama marked a gripping end to the league stage across multiple groups.

Atiqa Mir shines on junior S125 debut with historic top-five finish at Abu DhabiEleven-year-old Atiqa Mir delivered a stunning junior S125 debut, finishing fifth at Yas Marina to become the first Indian and first female to achieve a top-five finish on debut in IAME UAE history.

Smriti's message for youngsters in WPL: Performances can open doors to T20 World CupSmriti Mandhana said strong performances in the WPL can open doors to India selection, stressing that young players with standout seasons will be in contention for the Women's T20 World Cup.

Former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer dies after collapsing during matchK Lalremruata, a former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer, passed away after collapsing during a local tournament match, leading to the cancellation of all scheduled cricket matches as a mark of respect.

WPL 2026: Squads, schedule, live streaming details and moreThe Women's Premier League is all set for its fourth season with the teams ready to battle it out for the crown. Here's all you need to know about the new campaign, which will begin on January 9.

Pakistan Super League expands with Sialkot, Hyderabad sold for record pricesThe Pakistan Super League took a major step towards expansion on Thursday, with two new franchises sold at record prices at an auction on Thursday, confirming an eight-team league from the 11th edition onward.

Smith, Starc's BBL return: Sydney Sixers player jokes he may lose starting spotSydney Sixers star Joel Davies joked that he may be axed when Steve Smith and Mitchell Starc return to the team for the remainder of the Big Bash League 2026. Smith and Starc said that they will turn up for the Sixers after the Ashes win.

SRH new recruit Shivang Kumar spins a web in Vijay Hazare TrophyVijay Hazare Trophy: 23-year-old Shivang Kumar, playing for Madhya Pradesh, is impressing with his left-arm wrist-spin and big-hitting ability. On Thursday, the SunRisers Hyderabad new recruit picked up his maiden five-wicket haul in their win over Karnataka in Ahmedabad.

Delhi Capitals' Auqib Nabi hits maiden hundred as J&K stun HyderabadFresh off becoming a prized recruit for Delhi Capitals, Auqib Nabi produced one of the finest knocks of his List-A career, guiding Jammu and Kashmir to a stunning three-wicket win over Hyderabad in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

Harry Brook's nightclub incident doesn't surprise Vaughan: England have been looseMichael Vaughan said that he wasn't surprised to hear about Harry Brook's nightclub incident ahead of the New Zealand tour. Vaughan said that England have been loose both on and off the field in recent times after losing the Ashes 1-4.

Egyptian player's bizarre professional debut goes viralThe lopsided match at a Nairobi ITF tournament, featuring Egyptian wildcard Hajar Abdelkader, who won just three points, has sparked global debate over professional standards, wildcard scrutiny and competitive integrity in lower-tier tennis events.

No champagne showers: Australia give Khawaja final tribute during Ashes celebrationThere were no champagne showers during the Ashes trophy celebrations as the Australian team gave a perfect tribute to the retiring Usman Khawaja after the SCG Test on Thursday, January 8.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
